title: Brown (A. Samler)
body:
E.: Madeira, Canary Islands and AÃ§ores, a practical and complete guide for the use of tourists and invalids, London).

This guide, one of the most complete ever published, contains a lot of useful information not only about the history, geology, climate, etc. of the main islands of the Madeira, Canary Islands, and Azores archipelagos, but also about the points of interest on these islands for foreigners. The 100th edition, published in 1910, contains 20 maps and plans, and more useful explanations than previous editions.

It was only from 1901 onwards that Mr. Samler Brown began to focus on the Azores islands, and the work appeared in 1889 with the following title: Madeira and Canary Islands, etc.. (London).

1901: Mr. Samler Brown began to focus on the Azores islands
